channel.title: math.GM updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.GM updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: The Choquet-like operator with respect to an admissible order as a tool for aggregating multivalued data
item.description: arXiv:2404.07994v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In this paper, we propose a new generalization of the classical discrete Choquet integral to the multivalued framework in terms of an admissible order that refines the natural partial order on the considered value set. The new Choquet-like operator takes as input a finite number of values of a given type, in particular real numbers, intervals, and vectors, and returns a~single output value of the same type as the input values. We give necessary and sufficient conditions for the operator to be monotone with respect to the admissible order. We then provide a complete characterization of the Choquet-like operator as an aggregation function with respect to the admissible order and study its selected special cases.
item.dc:creator: Micha{\l} Boczek, Tomasz J\'ozefiak, Marek Kaluszka, Andrzej Okolewski

item.title: Fractal Calculus to Derive Fractal Frenet Equations for Fractal Curves
item.description: arXiv:2404.07996v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: This paper introduces the concept of Fractal Frenet equations, a set of differential equations used to describe the behavior of vectors along fractal curves. The study explores the analogue of arc length for fractal curves, providing a measure to quantify their length. It also discusses fundamental mathematical constructs, such as the analogue of the unit tangent vector, which indicates the curve's direction at different points, and the analogue of curvature vector or fractal curvature vector, which characterizes its curvature at various locations. The concept of torsion, describing the twisting and turning of fractal curves in three-dimensional space, is also explored. Specific examples, like the fractal helix and the fractal snowflake, illustrate the application and significance of the Fractal Frenet equations.
item.dc:creator: Alireza Khalili Golmankhaneh, Palle E. T. J{\o}rgensen, Dimiter Prodanov

item.title: Some questions of connection between summation functions and the corresponding Dirichlet series
item.description: arXiv:2404.08012v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The paper proves a generalization of Wintner's theorem on the asymptotics of summation functions to the case of summation functions with nonlinear asymptotics. The class of arithmetic functions that have a logarithmic asymptotic mean is studied. The Kronecker lemma is generalized to the case when the corresponding Dirichlet series diverges. Several assertions are proven and illustrative examples are given.
item.dc:creator: Victor Volfson

item.title: A systematic approach to Diophantine equations: open problems
item.description: arXiv:2404.08518v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: This paper collects polynomial Diophantine equations that are amazingly simple to write down but are apparently difficult to solve.
item.dc:creator: Bogdan Grechuk

item.title: An inequality of multiple integral of $s$ norm of vectors in $\mathbb{R}^n$
item.description: arXiv:2212.00071v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: In this note, we prove some new inequalities. To facilitate this proof, we introduce the notion of the local product on a sheet and associated space.
item.dc:creator: Theophilus Agama

item.title: An Introduction to Zoli Numbers
item.description: arXiv:math/0510056v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: There have been many theories about the paradoxes of numbers, but this is far and away more paradoxical than most. In this paper we will present the Zoli Numbers which have some innovative characteristics. The basic concept of these numbers is that they don't follow strictly any Mathematical rule. They are called Zoli from the names of Zotos and Litke. We are going to see some examples with the Zoli Programming Language and reveal the connection with other mathematical topics.
item.dc:creator: Kostas Zotos, Andreas Litke
